comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

Print one month, e.g. december (selected first to 31. december)


Actual results:

The month and some days of the following month are printed. however, if there are appointments in the first days of the following month, those are not printed (just empty cells for the first days of the following month)


Expected results:

Either don't print any cells for the following month / not selected timespan or at if printing the first days of the next month don't leave the cells empty, if there are appointments for it. actually it's very confusing, because the print tells you "hey there's nothing for january 1st" while there maybe is! I would prefer "don't print any cells for the following month / not selected timespan" - if I request a print from 1st to 31. december, then I see no logical reason why I get a printout with the first january days.

Expected results:

I would prefer "don't print any cells for the following month / not selected timespan" - if I request a print from 1st to 31. december, then I see no logical reason why I get a printout with the first january days.
comments.author: stefan.at.wpf@googlemail.com
comments.creator: stefan.at.wpf@googlemail.com

comments.raw_text: In Thunderbird 91 the layout still includes days from the months before and after but without any events, although there exists events on those days. Those days should be invisible or show the existing events.
comments.text: In Thunderbird 91 the layout still includes days from the months before and after but without any events, although there exists events on those days. Those days should be invisible or show the existing events.
comments.author: mschroeder@mozilla.x-home.org
